1. Clinical diagnosis of mitochondrial disease (mitochondrial DNA deletions due to PE01 gene mutation) 
2. Severe nigral degeneration without lewy bodies. 
The patient presented with progressive external ophthalmoplegia, ptosis, and mild parkinsonism and subsequently underwent multiple investigation leading to the diagnosis of a familial mitochondral disorder. Neuropathological examination showed severe substantia nigra neuronal loss but no lewy bodies. There were also some degenerative changes in cerebellar cortex, with loss of purkinje, and probably, granular neurons. It has been noted that movement disorders associated with mitochondrial disease may show paradoxical clinical-anatomic correlation's such that severe nigral degeneration may be found in individuals who had only mld or even no clinical signs of parkinsonism.,
